Summary Results-oriented, high-energy, hands-on Procurement Manager with twelve years of progressive and diverse responsibilities in the high-tech manufacturing sector. Areas of excellence include project team management, operations management, supplier management, contracts development, contract negotiations, and business analysis.  
 
Unsurpassed track record managing multiple concurrent projects consisting of geographically dispersed and cross-functional teams in excess of 30 individuals. Repeatedly recognized for demonstrating excellence in customer service, results orientation, cultivating best practices, and leading efforts in relationship management. Oversee project budgets between $50 million and $400 million. 
 
Career marked with exciting challenges and successes. Demonstrated skills in employee development, organizational and operational improvements, team building, and customer service. Outstanding management and employee relations’ qualifications. Oversee project budgets between $2 million and $200 million. Reports directly to Global Procurement Manager and managed a portfolio of 25 suppliers and $40 million in spends. 
 
Accomplishments: 
	Facilitated all Sourcing and Procurement activities to create greatest possible strategic sourcing leverage to provide highest possible level of support for INVISTA internal and external customers. 
	Actively lead and managed the raw material and material processing of post-consumer fibers which enabled the innovative strategic product offering (TruBlend™ fiber technology) for INVSITA  
	Developed new outsource vendors in support of business needs by identifying suppliers, managing material specifications, directing the supply chain logistics, and quality system development. 
	Coordinated negotiations with an emphasis on security of supply, quality, and competitive pricing while achieving cost reductions in order to create long term value in accordance with MBM guiding principles. 
	Accountable and primary point of contact to outsource vendors regarding all operational matters. 
	Actively monitored supplier performance and initiated performance action plans to reduce project risk as well as strengthen the INVSITA/Supplier relationship. 
	Exceptional and high-speed integration into INVSITA culture and fiber manufacturing sector Senior Contracts Manager Intel Corporation June 2006  –  January 2011  (4 years 8 months) 	Efficiently Managed construction procurement and supplier relations for all Colorado Construction activities totaling $340 million. 
	Successfully achieved $24.2 million in cost savings through direct negotiations with trade contractors. 
	Developed and implemented project execution strategies and action plans that ensured the maximization of project scope, schedule, quality, budget, safety, and supplier relations. 
	Partnered with business leaders to identify and implement organizational development initiatives in order to increase employee focus and performance against department directives. 
	Led the consolidation of the supplier base and creation of a preferred supplier pool with local and global contracts in order to enhance supplier relations and reduce Corporate database costs. 
	Outstanding supplier and business partner manager acting as the liaison between the Intel customer and trade contractor management. CCM Intel 2009  –  2010  (1 year) Contracts Materials Manager Intel Corporation April 2003  –  June 2006  (3 years 3 months) 	Provided technical expertise and troubleshooting support to domestic and international facilities to resolve procurement issues ensuring project execution while enhancing supplier relationships.  
	Optimized “Best Total Cost” for my company driving the RFP process by using both traditional methods as well as internet negotiation platforms (Freemarkets and Ariba) while engaging suppliers, maintaining both quality and specification compliant products and services. 
	Delivered significant Company-wide cost savings and value improvement as a result of identifying and executing strategic purchasing opportunities for materials, services, and supplies. 
	Received the Intel Departmental Recognition Award as a result of developing the “Construction Manager As Advisor Contract” (Terms and Conditions) and project scope of work. 
	Proactively managed Intel/Supplier relationship through the development and execution of monthly supplier performance evaluations. Contract Administrator Intel Corporation July 2000  –  April 2003  (2 years 10 months) 	Analyzed supplier qualifications to ensure that Intel bid to contractors that were financially solvent, quality driven, schedule compliant, and maintained a robust safety culture. 
	Ensured contract compliance utilizing contract reviews, contract correspondence, and legal notices. 
	Prepared contract documents and project releases to enable purchase order generation. 
	Monitored the supplier invoicing process to ensure contractors were paid according to contract terms. 
	Performed commercial bid evaluations of supplier proposals and coordinated technical evaluations and recommendations to senior management.
